content.title: Time Scales in Physics: From Planck to Cosmic
content.summary: A comprehensive comparison of characteristic time scales in physics, from the Planck time (~10⁻⁴³ s) to the age of the universe (~10¹⁷ s), spanning 60 orders of magnitude.

time_scales.name: Planck Time
time_scales.physics: Quantum gravity regime. Time itself may become discrete or undefined.

time_scales.name: GUT Time
time_scales.physics: Grand unification era. All forces except gravity unified.

time_scales.name: Electroweak Time
time_scales.physics: Electroweak unification. Time scale for W/Z boson processes.

time_scales.name: Strong Interaction Time
time_scales.physics: Characteristic time for QCD processes. Light crossing nucleus.

time_scales.name: Atomic Time
time_scales.physics: Atomic orbital period. Characteristic time for atomic physics.

time_scales.name: Femtosecond
time_scales.physics: Molecular vibrations. Fastest laser pulses routinely available.

time_scales.name: Second
time_scales.physics: Human time scale. SI base unit defined by Cs-133 hyperfine transition.

time_scales.name: Year
time_scales.physics: Earth orbital period. Common astrophysical time unit.

time_scales.name: Age of Universe
time_scales.physics: 13.8 billion years. Total elapsed cosmic time since Big Bang.

key_ratios.interpretation: The universe has existed for about 10⁶⁰ Planck times
One second contains about 10⁴³ Planck times
Atomic processes are 26 orders of magnitude slower than Planck time

physical_meaning: Time for light to travel one Planck length
Shortest meaningful time interval (quantum gravity limit)
Time scale where quantum fluctuations dominate spacetime
Earliest moment after Big Bang accessible to physics
planck_time_significance.impossibility_of_shorter_times: Attempting to measure time intervals shorter than t_P would require energy concentrated in a region smaller than ℓ_P, forming a black hole and destroying the clock.

cosmological_context.planck_epoch: t < t_P: Unknown physics, likely quantum gravity
cosmological_context.gut_epoch: t_P < t < 10⁻³⁶ s: Grand unification era
cosmological_context.electroweak_epoch: 10⁻³⁶ s < t < 10⁻¹² s: Separate strong and electroweak
cosmological_context.hadron_epoch: 10⁻⁶ s < t < 1 s: Quarks confined to hadrons
cosmological_context.nucleosynthesis: 1 s < t < 180 s: Primordial nuclear synthesis

content.statement: Time Scales in Physics: From Planck to Cosmic is a fundamental concept in Natural-Sciences Physics Quantum-Mechanics Planck-Units that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Time Scales in Physics: From Planck to Cosmic helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Time Scales in Physics: From Planck to Cosmic include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Time Scales in Physics: From Planck to Cosmic.
